newsitem.title: USA: Calif. insurance fund pays dividends of $55 mln.
newsitem.headline: Calif. insurance fund pays dividends of $55 mln.

text.p: The State Compensation Insurance Fund, California's largest workers' compensation carrier, said on Monday it was paying policyholder dividends of about $55 million.
The Fund said thousands of state employers would receive checks over the next several months under the largest dividend payout this year in the workers' compensation industry.
Dividends are a return of a portion of premiums collected from policyholders who have managed to reduce their workers' compensation losses below original expectations for a given policy period.

The $55 million in dividends includes an initial declaration by State Fund of about $31 million for the first quarter of 1995, as well as an estimated additional $24 million arising from the adjustment of its 1994 policyholder dividend.

State Fund said it anticipates additional dividend declarations for the second, third and fourth quarters, as well as a routine adjustment of the 1995 policy year, which should bring the total payout to about $97.5 million.
The State Compensation Insurance Fund is California's largest provider of workers' compensation coverage with approximately 250,000 policyholders.
Established by the California state Legislature in 1914, State Fund guarantees the availability of workers' compensation to all California employers.
